string.name: about_license
string.translation_description: In the 'About' page, the button on the bottom to view the terms of service agreement.

string.name: about_privacy
string.translation_description: In the 'About My Tracks' page, label for the privacy link. E.g., 'Privacy: m.google.com/privacy'.

string.name: about_support
string.translation_description: In the 'About My Tracks' page, label for the support link. E.g., 'Support: mytracks.appspot.com'.

string.name: about_team
string.translation_description: In the 'About My Tracks' page, label for the team members. E.g., 'Team: Sandor Dornbush, Rodrigo Damazio'.

string.name: about_version
string.translation_description: In the 'About My Tracks' page, label for the version number. E.g., 'Version: 1.1.10'.

string.name: chart_settings_by_distance
string.translation_description: In the Chart Settings, under the 'X Axis' section, the radio option to show the charts by distance. The other radio option is to show by time. User can only choose one of the options.

string.name: chart_settings_by_time
string.translation_description: In the Chart Settings, under the 'X Axis' section, the radio option to show the charts by time. The other radio option is to show by distance. User can only choose one of the options.

string.name: chart_settings_x_axis
string.translation_description: In the Chart Settings, the section label for configuring the X axis.

string.name: chart_settings_y_axis
string.translation_description: In the Chart Settings, the section label for configuring the Y axis.

string.name: eula_accept
string.translation_description: In the 'End User License Agreement' dialog, the button to accept.

string.name: eula_decline
string.translation_description: In the 'End User License Agreement' dialog, the button to decline.

string.name: eula_title
string.translation_description: The title for the terms of service dialog, asking the user to accept or decline.

string.name: export_canceled
string.translation_description: When exporting a track to the SD card, a message indicating that the export operation was canceled.

string.name: export_error
string.translation_description: When exporting a track to the SD card, a generic error message indicating unable to export.

string.name: export_progress_message
string.translation_description: When exporting a track to the SD card, the message on the progress dialog indicating that it may take a while.

resources.string: Exporting a track to the SD card. This may take a while.

string.name: export_success
string.translation_description: After exporting all the tracks, a toast message indicating success.

string.name: generic_cancel
string.translation_description: The text on a button to say cancel.

string.name: generic_confirm_title
string.translation_description: The title on a confirmation dialog asking the user if he is sure?

string.name: generic_error
string.translation_description: The title on an alert dialog indicating error.

string.name: generic_no
string.translation_description: The text on a button to say no.

string.name: generic_ok
string.translation_description: The text on a button to say ok.

string.name: generic_progress_title
string.translation_description: The title on a progress dialog asking the user to wait.

string.name: generic_save
string.translation_description: The text on a button to say save.

string.name: generic_success
string.translation_description: The title on an alert dialog indicating success.

string.name: generic_yes
string.translation_description: The text on a button to say yes.

string.name: gps_need_to_enable
string.translation_description: In the main view, the message on the top asking the user to enable GPS.

resources.string: Please tap here to go to \'Location & security\' settings and check \'Use GPS satellites\'. Press the back button to return.

string.name: gps_not_found
string.translation_description: On application start, message when there is no GPS on the device.

resources.string: No GPS is found on the device.

string.name: gps_wait_for_fix
string.translation_description: In the main view, the message on the top indicating My Tracks is waiting for a better GPS fix.

resources.string: Waiting for a better GPS fix. Make sure the sky is visible.

string.name: import_error
string.translation_description: When importing all the tracks, a toast message indicating error for one of the tracks. E.g., 'Import error for file /mnt/sdcard/MyTacks/gpx/1.gpx'.

string.name: import_no_file
string.translation_description: After importing all the tracks from the SD card, the alert message indicating that no track is imported. E.g., 'No GPX file found in /mnt/sdcard/MyTracks/gpx/. SD card may be unreadable or directory may not contain any GPX file.'.

resources.string: No GPX file found in %s. SD card may be unreadable or directory may not contain any GPX file.

string.name: import_success
string.translation_description: After importing all the tracks from the SD card, the alert message indicating success. E.g., 'Imported 5 of 6 GPX files from /mnt/sdcard/MyTracks/gpx/'.

resources.string: Imported to My Tracks %1$d of %2$d GPX files from %3$s

string.name: marker_detail_marker_description
string.translation_description: In the detail page for a waypoint marker, the text field for the marker description.

string.name: marker_detail_marker_name
string.translation_description: In the detail page for a waypoint or statistics marker, text field for the marker name.

string.name: marker_detail_marker_type
string.translation_description: In the detail page for a waypoint marker, the text field for the marker type, including examples.

string.name: marker_detail_marker_type_hint
string.translation_description: In the detail page for a waypoint marker, the hint in the 'Marker Type' text field when it is empty.

string.name: marker_detail_title
string.translation_description: In the detail page for a waypoint or statistics marker, the title of the page.

string.name: marker_insert_error
string.translation_description: When inserting a marker, message when not able to insert due to no GPS location and asking the user to try again.

resources.string: Unable to insert marker. No GPS location. Try again.

string.name: marker_insert_success
string.translation_description: When inserting a new marker, a message indicating success.

string.name: marker_label_end
string.translation_description: When inserting a marker to indicate the end of a track, the label at the end of the marker name. E.g., the marker is named 'track_name (End)'.

string.name: marker_label_start
string.translation_description: When inserting a marker to indicate the beginning of a track, the label at the end of the marker name. E.g., the marker is named 'track_name (Start)'.

string.name: marker_list_delete_marker
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a marker, the menu option to delete the marker.

string.name: marker_list_delete_marker_confirm_message
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a marker, when pressing the 'Delete' option, the confirmation dialog message informing the user that the marker will be permanently deleted from the phone.

resources.string: The marker will be permanently deleted from the phone.

string.name: marker_list_edit_marker
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a marker, the menu option to edit the marker's metadata (e.g., name, type, etc.).

string.name: marker_list_insert_statistics
string.translation_description: In the Markers page, the button on the bottom to insert a statistics marker.

string.name: marker_list_insert_waypoint
string.translation_description: In the Markers page, the button on the bottom to insert a waypoint marker.

string.name: marker_list_pick_one
string.translation_description: In the Markers page, the instruction at the top of the page informing the user he can press and hold a marker for more options.

resources.string: Pick a marker. Press & hold for more options.

string.name: marker_list_show_on_map
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a marker, the menu option to show the marker on the map.

string.name: marker_list_this_marker
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a marker, the title indicating that all the menu options below are for this marker.

string.name: marker_type_statistics
string.translation_description: When inserting a statistics marker, the default name of the marker.

string.name: marker_type_waypoint
string.translation_description: When inserting a waypoint marker, the default name of the marker.

string.name: menu_aggregated_statistics
string.translation_description: In the menu, to go to the aggregated statistics page.

string.name: menu_chart_view_chart_settings
string.translation_description: In the menu for the chart view, to change the chart settings.

string.name: menu_help
string.translation_description: In the menu, to go to the help page.

string.name: menu_map_view_map_mode
string.translation_description: In the menu for the map view, to switch the display to the map mode.

string.name: menu_map_view_my_location
string.translation_description: In the menu for the map view, to display user's current location.

string.name: menu_map_view_satellite_mode
string.translation_description: In the menu for the map view, to switch the display to the satellite mode.

string.name: menu_markers
string.translation_description: In the menu, to show a list of markers for the current track.

string.name: menu_record_track
string.translation_description: In the menu, to start recording a track.

string.name: menu_sensor_state
string.translation_description: In the menu, to go to the sensor state page.

string.name: menu_settings
string.translation_description: In the menu, to go to the settings page.

string.name: menu_stop_recording
string.translation_description: In the menu, to stop recording a track.

string.name: menu_tracks
string.translation_description: In the menu, to show a list of all the tracks.

string.name: my_location_approximate_location
string.translation_description: When displaying the user's current location, a status message indicating that GPS is not available and an approximate location is used instead.

resources.string: GPS is not available. An approximate location based on cell towers and WIFI networks is shown.

string.name: my_location_no_location
string.translation_description: When displaying the user's current location, a status message indicating that the current location cannot be determined.

resources.string: GPS is not available. Current location cannot be determined. Enable more location sources (see \'Location & security\' settings) and make sure the sky is visible. Try again later.

string.name: my_maps_list_error
string.translation_description: When sending a track to an existing Google My Map, the text on the 'My Maps' list page informing the user that his maps cannot be loaded at this time.

resources.string: Your maps could not be loaded at this time.

string.name: my_maps_list_loading
string.translation_description: When sending a track to an existing Google My Map, the progress dialog message informing the user that his maps are being loaded.

string.name: my_maps_list_no_maps
string.translation_description: When sending a track to an existing Google My Map, the text on the 'My Maps' list page informing the user that he doesn't have any maps.

string.name: my_maps_list_pick_map
string.translation_description: When sending a track to an existing Google My Map, the text on the 'My Maps' list page asking the user to pick one of his maps.

string.name: my_maps_list_public_label
string.translation_description: When sending a track to an existing Google My Map, in the 'My Maps' list page, the label next to the maps that are public, as opposed to being unlisted.

string.name: my_maps_list_title
string.translation_description: When sending a track to an existing Google My Map, the title of the page listing the user's maps in Google My Maps.

string.name: my_maps_list_unlisted_label
string.translation_description: When sending a track to an existing Google My Map, in the 'My Maps' list page, the label next to the maps that are unlisted, as opposed to being public.

string.name: permission_notification_description
string.translation_description: When installing a third-party app that wants to receive My Tracks notifications, the permission description that the Android Market shows to the user.

resources.string: Allows the application to receive notifications when My Tracks starts or stops a recording.

string.name: permission_notification_label
string.translation_description: When installing a third-party app that wants to receive My Tracks notifications, the permission label that the Android Market shows to the user.

string.name: permission_read_description
string.translation_description: When installing a third-party app that wants to read My Tracks data, the permission description that the Android Market shows to the user.

resources.string: Allows the application to read My Tracks data.

string.name: permission_read_label
string.translation_description: When installing a third-party app that wants to read My Tracks data, the permission label that the Android Market shows to the user.

string.name: permission_write_description
string.translation_description: When installing a third-party app that wants to write data to My Tracks, the permission description that the Android Market shows to the user.

resources.string: Allows the application to write data to My Tracks and start/stop My Tracks recording.

string.name: permission_write_label
string.translation_description: When installing a third-party app that wants to write data to My Tracks, the permission label that the Android Market shows to the user.

resources.string: write data to My Tracks and start/stop My Tracks recording

string.name: preferred_units_imperial
string.translation_description: In the dialog asking the user to choose a preferred units, the option to choose the imperial units.

string.name: preferred_units_metric
string.translation_description: In the dialog asking the user to choose a preferred units, the option to choose the metric units.

string.name: preferred_units_title
string.translation_description: The title of the dialog asking the user to choose a preferred units, metric or imperial.

string.name: sd_card_error_create_dir
string.translation_description: When writing to the SD card, the error message when not able to create a directory on the SD card.

resources.string: Unable to create directory on SD card.

string.name: sd_card_error_no_storage
string.translation_description: When writing to the SD card, the error message when the SD card is not found.

resources.string: No external storage was found. Make sure that a SD card is inserted and that your phone is not mounted to a computer.

string.name: sd_card_error_read_file
string.translation_description: When reading from the SD card, the error message when not able to read a file.

string.name: sd_card_error_write_file
string.translation_description: When writing to the SD card, the error message when not able to write a file.

string.name: sd_card_success_read_file
string.translation_description: When reading from the SD card, the success message when finish reading from the SD card.

string.name: sd_card_success_write_file
string.translation_description: When writing to the SD card, the success message when finish writing to the SD card.

string.name: send_google_by_my_tracks
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, a note indicating it is created by My Tracks on Android. The two string placeholders are used to insert the html link tags around 'My Tracks'. E.g., 'Created by My Tracks on Android.'.

string.name: send_google_choose_account
string.translation_description: When sending to Google, the dialog title to choose a Google account.

string.name: send_google_docs
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, under the 'Send to...' dialog, the checkbox option to send to Google Docs.

string.name: send_google_error
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, a message indicating that an error has occurred and ask the user to try again.

resources.string: An error occurred. Please try again.

string.name: send_google_error_docs
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google Docs, a message indicating that an error has occurred.

resources.string: There was an error while sending your track to Google Docs.

string.name: send_google_error_fusion_tables
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google Fusion Table, a message indicating that an error has occurred.

resources.string: There was an error while sending your track to Google Fusion Tables.

string.name: send_google_error_my_maps
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google My Maps, a message indicating that an error has occurred.

resources.string: There was an error while sending your track to Google My Maps.

string.name: send_google_existing_map
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google My Maps, the radio option to use an existing map as opposed to create a new map.

string.name: send_google_fusion_tables
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, under the 'Send to...' dialog, the checkbox option to send to Google Fusion Tables.

string.name: send_google_my_maps
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, under the 'Send to...' dialog, the checkbox option to send to Google My Maps.

string.name: send_google_new_map
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google My Maps, the radio option to create a new map as opposed to use an existing map.

string.name: send_google_no_account
string.translation_description: When sending to Google, the dialog title when no Google account is found.

string.name: send_google_no_account_message
string.translation_description: When sending to Google, the dialog message when no Google account is found.

resources.string: No account found to upload tracks to.

string.name: send_google_progress_auth_docs
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google Docs, the message on the progress dialog indicating authenticating to Google Docs.

string.name: send_google_progress_auth_fusion_tables
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google Fusion Tables, the message on the progress dialog indicating authenticating to Google Fusion Tables.

string.name: send_google_progress_auth_my_maps
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google My Maps, the message on the progress dialog indicating authenticating to Google My Maps.

string.name: send_google_progress_creating_fusion_table
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google Fusion Tables, the message on the progress dialog indicating My Tracks is creating a new Fusion Table in Google Fusion Tables.

string.name: send_google_progress_creating_map
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google My Maps, the message on the progress dialog indicating My Tracks is creating a new map in Google My Maps.

string.name: send_google_progress_preparing_track
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google My Maps, the message on the progress dialog indicating My Tracks is preparing the track's data for upload.

string.name: send_google_progress_reading_track
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, the message on the progress dialog indicating My Tracks is reading the track from its database.

string.name: send_google_progress_sending_docs
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google Docs, the message on the progress dialog indicating My Tracks is sending the track data.

resources.string: Sending a track to Google Docs...

string.name: send_google_progress_sending_fusion_tables
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google Fusion Tables, the message on the progress dialog indicating My Tracks is sending the track data.

resources.string: Sending a track to Google Fusion Tables...

string.name: send_google_progress_sending_my_maps
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google My Maps, the message on the progress dialog indicating My Tracks is sending the track data.

resources.string: Sending a track to Google My Maps...

string.name: send_google_recorded
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, in the track description, a tag for the track recorded date. E.g., 'Recorded: Tue Sep 06 15:08:30 PDT 2011'.

string.name: send_google_result_share_url
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, in the result dialog, the button on the bottom to share with friends the URL of the uploaded track.

string.name: send_google_result_title
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, the header on the top of the result page.

string.name: send_google_send_now
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, under the 'Send to...' dialog, the button on the bottom to send the track to the selected Google services.

string.name: send_google_success_existing_doc
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google Docs, the message on the result page indicating that the track is sent to an existing spreadsheet. E.g., 'Your track has been sent to docs.google.com.'.

resources.string: Your track has been sent to %s.

string.name: send_google_success_existing_map
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google My Maps, the message on the result page indicating that the track is sent to an existing map. E.g., 'Your track has been sent to maps.google.com.'

resources.string: Your track has been sent to %s.

string.name: send_google_success_footer
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, the additional comment on the bottom of the result page.

resources.string: It may take a few minutes before new tracks appear.

string.name: send_google_success_fusion_tables
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google Fusion Tables, the message on the result page indicating success. E.g., 'A new Google Fusion table has been created at google.com/fusiontables.'

resources.string: A new Google Fusion table has been created at %s.

string.name: send_google_success_new_doc
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google Docs, the message on the result page indicating that a new spreadsheet is created. E.g., 'A new spreadsheet is created at docs.google.com.'.

resources.string: A new spreadsheet is created at %s.

string.name: send_google_success_new_map
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google My Maps, the message on the result page indicating that a new map is created. E.g., 'A new Google My Map has been created at maps.google.com.'.

resources.string: A new Google My Map has been created at %s.

string.name: send_google_title
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, the dialog title to choose the Google services to send the track to. The user can choose Google My Maps, Google Fusion Tables, and Google Docs.

string.name: send_google_track_part_label
string.translation_description: When sending a track to Google, the label to name segments when splitting a large track. E.g., '(Part 1)'.

string.name: sensor_state_battery
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor State' page, the label for the battery level on the bike sensor. E.g, 'Battery Level: 50 %'.

string.name: sensor_state_cadence
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor State' page, the label for the cadence on the bike sensor. Cadence is the number of revolutions of the crank per minute. E.g., 'Cadence: 80 rpm'.

string.name: sensor_state_connected
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor State' page, the 'Sensor State' value when the sensor has connected.

string.name: sensor_state_connecting
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor State' page, the 'Sensor State' value when the sensor is connecting.

string.name: sensor_state_disconnected
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor State' page, the 'Sensor State' value when the sensor has disconnected.

string.name: sensor_state_heart_rate
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor State' page, the label for the heart rate from a heart rate sensor. E.g., 'Hear Rate: 100 bpm'.

string.name: sensor_state_last_sensor_time
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor State' page, the label for the last time the sensor has sent a data. E.g., 'Last Sensor Time: 10:05 am'.

string.name: sensor_state_power
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor State' page, the label for the power from the bike sensor. Power is the power output of the rider. E.g., 'Power: 50 W'.

string.name: sensor_state_sending
string.translation_description: In the 'Sensor State' page, the 'Sensor State' value when the sensor is sending data.

string.name: settings_backup
string.translation_description: In the Settings page, the option to change the data backup related settings.

string.name: settings_backup_now
string.translation_description: In the Backup settings, under the 'SD Card Backup' section, the option to backup to the SD card now.

string.name: settings_backup_now_progress_message
string.translation_description: In the Backup settings, after pressing the 'Backup now' option, the progress dialog telling the user that it is writing all tracks and settings and that it may take a while.

resources.string: Writing all tracks and settings to the SD card. This may take a while...

string.name: settings_backup_now_summary
string.translation_description: In the Backup settings, under the 'SD Card Backup' section, the summary for the 'Backup now' option explaining that all tracks and settings will be written to the SD card.

resources.string: Write a full copy of all your tracks and settings to the SD card

string.name: settings_backup_restore
string.translation_description: In the Backup settings, under the 'SD Card Backup' section, the option to restore everything from the SD card.

string.name: settings_backup_restore_confirm_message
string.translation_description: In the Backup settings, after pressing the 'Restore now' option, the message in the alert dialog asking the user to confirm that he wants to restore from a backup and it will overwrite all the current tracks and settings.

resources.string: Restoring a backup from the SD card will OVERWRITE all your current tracks and settings. Are you sure?

string.name: settings_backup_restore_no_backup
string.translation_description: In the Backup settings, after pressing the 'Restore now' option, the message in the alert dialog informing the user that there is no backup to restore from.

string.name: settings_backup_restore_progress_message
string.translation_description: In the Backup settings, after pressing the 'Restore now' option, the message on the progress dialog indicating that My Tracks is reading all tracks and settings from the backup on the SD card and that it may take a while.

resources.string: Reading all tracks and settings from the SD card. This may take a while...

string.name: settings_backup_restore_select
string.translation_description: In the Backup settings, after pressing the 'Restore now' option, the title in the picker dialog asking the user to select a backup.

string.name: settings_backup_restore_summary
string.translation_description: In the Backup settings, under the 'SD Card Backup' section, the summary for the 'Restore now' option explaining that it restores all tracks and settings from the SD card.

resources.string: Restore all tracks and settings from the SD card

string.name: settings_backup_sd_card
string.translation_description: In the Backup settings, the section title for configuring backup to the SD card.

string.name: settings_display
string.translation_description: In the Settings page, the option to change the display related settings.

string.name: settings_display_metric
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, the checkbox option to use the metric units.

string.name: settings_display_metric_summary_off
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, the summary for the 'Use metric units' checkbox when it is unchecked explaining using the imperial units to display distances.

resources.string: Use imperial units to display distances

string.name: settings_display_metric_summary_on
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, the summary for the 'Use metric units' checkbox when it is checked explaining using the metric units to display distances.

resources.string: Use metric units to display distances

string.name: settings_display_speed
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, the checkbox option to display speed (e.g., 5 miles per hour) instead of pace (e.g., 0.2 hours per mile).

string.name: settings_display_speed_summary_off
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, the summary for the 'Display speed' checkbox when it is unchecked explaining that pace (e.g., 0.2 hours per mile) will be used instead of speed (e.g., 5 miles per hour).

string.name: settings_display_speed_summary_on
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, the summary for the 'Display speed' checkbox when it is checked explaining that speed (e.g., 5 miles per hour) will be used instead of pace (e.g., 0.2 hours per mile).

string.name: settings_display_track_color
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, the dropdown option to choose a track color mode for how to use different colors to color a track based on speed.

string.name: settings_display_track_color_dynamic
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, for the 'Track color mode' dropdown, the option to use different colors to color a track based on dynamically determined speed thresholds. E.g., use one color for segments where the speed is below the average speed of the track.

string.name: settings_display_track_color_dynamic_medium
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, under the 'Dynamic Thresholds' configurations, the option for configuring the medium speed range. The track color mode will use different colors to color a track depending on whether the speed is above, in, or below the medium speed range.

string.name: settings_display_track_color_dynamic_medium_summary
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, under the 'Dynamic Thresholds' configurations, the summary for the 'Medium speed range' option explaining that it sets a percentage from the average speed to determine the medium speed range. The track color mode will use different colors to color a track depending on whether the speed is above, in, or below the medium speed range.

resources.string: Percentage from the average speed for the medium speed range

string.name: settings_display_track_color_fixed
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, for the 'Track color mode' dropdown, the option to use different colors to color a track based on fixed speed thresholds. E.g., use one color for segments where the speed is below a fixed speed threshold.

string.name: settings_display_track_color_fixed_medium
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, under the 'Fixed Thresholds' configurations, the option for configuring the medium speed threshold. Thus any speed lower than the threshold but greater than the slow speed threshold will be colored by the medium speed color.

string.name: settings_display_track_color_fixed_medium_summary
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, under the 'Fixed Thresholds' configurations, the summary for the 'Medium speed threshold' option explaining that it sets a cutoff speed for the medium speed color.

string.name: settings_display_track_color_fixed_slow
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, under the 'Fixed Thresholds' configurations, the option for configuring the slow speed threshold. Thus any speed lower than the threshold will be colored by the slow speed color.

string.name: settings_display_track_color_fixed_slow_summary
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, under the 'Fixed Thresholds' configurations, the summary for the 'Slow speed threshold' option explaining that it sets a cutoff speed for the slow speed color.

string.name: settings_display_track_color_single
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, for the 'Track color mode' dropdown, the option to only use a single color to color a track.

string.name: settings_display_track_color_summary
string.translation_description: In the Display settings, the summary for the 'Track color mode' dropdown explaining that it configures how colors are used to color a track based on speed.

resources.string: The way to color a track based on speed

string.name: settings_not_while_recording
string.translation_description: In the Settings page, the summary for an option that is not available during a track recording.

resources.string: Not available while recording a track

string.name: settings_recording
string.translation_description: In the Settings page, the option to change the track recording related settings.

string.name: settings_recording_auto_resume
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the dropdown option to configure the timeout after which a recorded track will not be continued after phone reboot.

string.name: settings_recording_auto_resume_summary
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the summary for the 'Auto-resume timeout' dropdown option explaining that it configures the maximum time after which a previous recording will not be resumed after phone reboot.

resources.string: Maximum time after which a previously recording track will not be resumed on phone reboot

string.name: settings_recording_default_activity
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the option to specify a new track's default activity type.

string.name: settings_recording_default_activity_summary
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the summary for the 'Default activity type' option explaining that it sets the default activity type for a new track.

resources.string: Default activity type for a new track.

string.name: settings_recording_distance
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the dropdown option to configure the distance between two recorded points.

string.name: settings_recording_distance_summary
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the summary for the 'Distance between points' dropdown option explaining that it configures the smallest distance between two recordings of your position.

resources.string: Smallest distance between two recordings of your position

string.name: settings_recording_gps_accuracy
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the dropdown option to configure the required GPS accuracy. If a GPS position's accuracy is below the requirement, then it will not be used.

string.name: settings_recording_gps_accuracy_summary
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the summary for the 'GPS accuracy' dropdown option explaining that it configures the required accuracy for your position. If a GPS position's accuracy is below the requirement, then it will not be used.

resources.string: GPS position will be ignored if it is not this accurate

string.name: settings_recording_interval
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the dropdown option to configure the time between two recorded points.

string.name: settings_recording_interval_summary
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the summary for the 'Time between points' dropdown option explaining that it configures the smallest time interval between two recordings of your position.

resources.string: Smallest time interval between two recordings of your position

string.name: settings_recording_marker
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the dropdown option to configure the time or distance a new marker will be inserted.

string.name: settings_recording_marker_summary
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the summary for the 'Marker frequency' dropdown option explaining that it configures the time or distance after which a new marker will be inserted.

resources.string: Time/distance after which a new marker will be inserted

string.name: settings_recording_name
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the checkbox on whether the track should be named based on the track's start time or based on a number.

string.name: settings_recording_name_summary_off
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the summary for the 'Use time for track name' checkbox when it is unchecked explaining using a number as the default track name.

resources.string: Use a number as the default track name

string.name: settings_recording_name_summary_on
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the summary for the 'Use time for track name' checkbox when it is checked explaining using the track's start time as the default track name.

resources.string: Use the track\'s start time as the default track name

string.name: settings_recording_track_distance
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the dropdown option to configure the distance between two tracks.

string.name: settings_recording_track_distance_summary
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the summary for the 'Distance between tracks' dropdown option explaining that it configures the maximum distance for two recorded points for them to be still considered as the same track.

resources.string: Track will be split if two recordings of your position are further than this

string.name: settings_recording_voice
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the dropdown option to configure the voice announcement frequency.

string.name: settings_recording_voice_not_available
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the summary for the 'Voice frequency' explaining that this option is not available on your Android phone.

resources.string: Voice announcement is not available on your Android phone

string.name: settings_recording_voice_summary
string.translation_description: In the Recording settings, the summary for the 'Voice frequency' dropdown option explaining that it configures the time or distance between two voice announcements.

string.name: settings_reset
string.translation_description: In the Settings page, the option to reset everything to the defaults.

string.name: settings_reset_dialog_message
string.translation_description: In the Settings page, after pressing the 'Reset to defaults' option, the confirmation dialog asking the user to confirm reverting all settings to defaults. But the saved tracks will be preserved.

resources.string: All your settings will be erased and reverted to the default values. Saved tracks will be preserved. Are you sure?

string.name: settings_reset_done
string.translation_description: In the Settings page, after pressing the 'Reset to defaults' option, the confirmation dialog informing the user that all settings have been reverted to their defaults.

resources.string: All settings have been reverted to their defaults.

string.name: settings_reset_summary
string.translation_description: In the Settings page, the summary for the 'Reset to defaults' option explaining reverting all the settings to the default values.

resources.string: Revert all your settings to the default values

string.name: settings_sensor
string.translation_description: In the Settings page, the option to change the sensor related settings.

string.name: settings_sensor_ant_not_paired
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, the summary for 'Unpair ANT+ heart rate sensor' or 'Unpair SRM ANT+ bridge' when there no ANT+ device paired.

string.name: settings_sensor_ant_options
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, the section title to configure the ANT+ options.

string.name: settings_sensor_ant_paired
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, the summary for 'Unpair ANT+ heart rate sensor' or 'Unpair SRM ANT+ bridge' when there is an ANT+ device paired. E.g., 'Paired with: 1'.

string.name: settings_sensor_bluetooth_options
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, the section title to configure the Bluetooth options.

string.name: settings_sensor_bluetooth_pairing
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, under the 'Bluetooth Options' configurations, the option to pair with a Bluetooth device.

string.name: settings_sensor_bluetooth_pairing_summary
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, under the 'Bluetooth Options' configurations, the summary for the 'Bluetooth pairing' option explaining that it will open the Android's Bluetooth settings to pair a device.

resources.string: Open Android\'s Bluetooth settings to pair a device

string.name: settings_sensor_bluetooth_sensor
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, under the 'Bluetooth Options' configurations, the dropdown option to pick a Bluetooth sensor.

string.name: settings_sensor_bluetooth_sensor_summary
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, under the 'Bluetooth Options' configurations, the summary for the 'Bluetooth sensor' dropdown option explaining it is to pick a Bluetooth sensor to connect to.

resources.string: The Bluetooth sensor to connect to

string.name: settings_sensor_type
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, the dropdown option to choose a sensor type.

string.name: settings_sensor_type_ant
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, for the 'Sensor Type' dropdown, the option to connect to an ANT+ heart rate sensor.

string.name: settings_sensor_type_none
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, for the 'Sensor Type' dropdown, the option to not connect to any sensor.

string.name: settings_sensor_type_polar
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, for the 'Sensor Type' dropdown, the option to connect to a Polar bluetooth sensor.

string.name: settings_sensor_type_srm
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, for the 'Sensor Type' dropdown, the option to connect to a SRM ANT+ bridge.

string.name: settings_sensor_type_summary
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, the summary for the 'Sensor Type' option explaining that it is to configure the type of sensor to connect to.

resources.string: The type of sensor to connect to

string.name: settings_sensor_type_zephyr
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, for the 'Sensor Type' dropdown, the option to connect to a Zephyr bluetooth sensor.

string.name: settings_sensor_unpair_ant
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, under the 'ANT+ Options' configurations, the option to unpair an ANT+ heart rate sensor.

string.name: settings_sensor_unpair_srm
string.translation_description: In the Sensor settings, under the 'ANT+ Options' configurations, the option to unpair a SRM ANT+ bridge.

string.name: settings_sharing
string.translation_description: In the Settings page, the option to change the track sharing related settings.

string.name: settings_sharing_allow_access
string.translation_description: In the Sharing settings, the checkbox option to allow third party apps access to the My Tracks data.

string.name: settings_sharing_allow_access_confirm_message
string.translation_description: In the Sharing settings, after checking the 'Allow access' checkbox, the confirmation dialog asking the user if he wants to allow other apps, including apps installed in the future, to control and access My Tracks data. In addition, no further notification of third party app access will be shown.

resources.string: Are you sure you want to allow other apps, including future apps, to control and access My Tracks data? There will be no further notification.

string.name: settings_sharing_allow_access_summary_off
string.translation_description: In the Sharing settings, the summary for the 'Allow access' checkbox option when it is unchecked explaining that other apps cannot read, write, start/stop recording My Tracks data.

resources.string: Other apps cannot read, write, start/stop recording My Tracks data.

string.name: settings_sharing_allow_access_summary_on
string.translation_description: In the Sharing settings, the summary for the 'Allow access' checkbox option when it is checked explaining that other apps can read, write, start/stop recording My Tracks data.

resources.string: Other apps can read, write, start/stop recording My Tracks data.

string.name: settings_sharing_map_public
string.translation_description: In the Sharing settings, the checkbox option to make a new map created in Google My Maps public.

string.name: settings_sharing_map_public_summary_off
string.translation_description: In the Sharing settings, the summary for the 'Make new maps public' checkbox option when it is unchecked explaining that new maps created in Google My Maps will be unlisted, as opposed to public.

resources.string: Make new maps created in Google My Maps unlisted

string.name: settings_sharing_map_public_summary_on
string.translation_description: In the Sharing settings, the summary for the 'Make new maps public' checkbox option when it is checked explaining that new maps created in Google My Maps will be public, as opposed to unlisted.

resources.string: Make new maps created in Google My Maps public

string.name: settings_sharing_url_only
string.translation_description: In the Sharing settings, the checkbox option to share only the URL link, without any additional text, when sharing the URL with friends.

string.name: settings_sharing_url_only_summary_off
string.translation_description: In the Sharing settings, the summary for the 'Share only URL link' checkbox option when it is unchecked explaining that some text and the the URL link will be sent when sharing the URL with friends.

resources.string: Some text and the URL link will be sent when sharing the URL with friends.

string.name: settings_sharing_url_only_summary_on
string.translation_description: In the Sharing settings, the summary for the 'Share only URL link' checkbox option when it is checked explaining that only the URL link, without any additional text, will be sent when sharing the URL with friends.

resources.string: Only the URL link will be sent when sharing the URL with friends.

string.name: settings_title
string.translation_description: The title of the Settings page.

string.name: share_track_file_body_format
string.translation_description: When sharing a track file with friends, the body of the message.

resources.string: I think you might be interested in this track.\n\nTo view this track use Google Earth or other mapping software.

string.name: share_track_picker_title
string.translation_description: When sharing a track with friends, the title on the picker to ask the user which application he wants to use.

string.name: share_track_subject
string.translation_description: When sharing a track with friends, the subject line.

resources.string: I would like to share a track with you

string.name: share_track_url_body_format
string.translation_description: When sharing a track URL with friends, the body of the message. E.g., 'I think you might be interested in this track:\n\nhttps://maps.google.com/maps'.

resources.string: I think you might be interested in this track:\n\n%s

string.name: stat_average_moving_pace
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the average moving pace.

string.name: stat_average_moving_speed
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the average moving speed.

string.name: stat_average_pace
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the average pace.

string.name: stat_average_speed
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the average speed.

string.name: stat_elevation
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the elevation.

string.name: stat_elevation_gain
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the elevation gain.

string.name: stat_latitude
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the latitude.

string.name: stat_longitude
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the longitude.

string.name: stat_max_elevation
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the maximum elevation.

string.name: stat_max_grade
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the maximum grade.

string.name: stat_max_speed
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the maximum speed.

string.name: stat_min_elevation
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the minimum elevation.

string.name: stat_min_grade
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the minimum grade.

string.name: stat_min_pace
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the minimum pace.

string.name: stat_moving_time
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the moving time.

string.name: stat_pace
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the pace like hours per mile.

string.name: stat_speed
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the speed like miles per hour.

string.name: stat_total_distance
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the total distance.

string.name: stat_total_time
string.translation_description: In the Statistic view, the total time.

string.name: track_detail_activity_type
string.translation_description: In the detail page for a track, the text field for the activity type, including for examples.

resources.string: Activity Type (e.g. hiking, cycling, running, climbing...)

string.name: track_detail_activity_type_hint
string.translation_description: In the detail page for a track, the hint in the 'Activity Type' text field when it is empty.

string.name: track_detail_title
string.translation_description: In the detail page for a track, the title of the page.

string.name: track_detail_track_description
string.translation_description: In the detail page for a track, the text field for the track description.

string.name: track_detail_track_name
string.translation_description: In the detail page for a track, the text field for the track name.

string.name: track_list_clear_map
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, the menu option to clear the map of any track.

string.name: track_list_delete_all
string.translation_description: In the Tracks page, the button on the bottom to delete all tracks.

string.name: track_list_delete_all_confirm_message
string.translation_description: In the Tracks page, when pressing the 'Delete all' button, the confirmation dialog message informing the user that all tracks and markers will be permanently deleted from the phone.

resources.string: All tracks and markers will be permanently deleted from the phone.

string.name: track_list_delete_track
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, the menu option to delete the track from the phone.

string.name: track_list_delete_track_confirm_message
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, when pressing the 'Delete from phone...' option, the confirmation dialog message informing the user that the track and its markers will be permanently deleted from the phone.

resources.string: The track and its markers will be permanently deleted from the phone.

string.name: track_list_edit_track
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, the menu option to edit the track's metadata (e.g., name, activity type, etc.).

string.name: track_list_export_all
string.translation_description: In the Tracks page, the button on the bottom to export all tracks.

string.name: track_list_import_all
string.translation_description: In the Tracks page, the button on the bottom to import all tracks.

string.name: track_list_pick_one
string.translation_description: In the Tracks page, the instruction at the top of the page informing the user he can press and hold a track for more options.

resources.string: Pick a track. Press & hold for more options.

string.name: track_list_save_csv_file
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, under the 'Save to SD card...' option, the menu option to save the track as a CSV file.

string.name: track_list_save_gpx_file
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, under the 'Save to SD card...' option, the menu option to save the track as a GPX file.

string.name: track_list_save_kml_file
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, under the 'Save to SD card...' option, the menu option to save the track as a KML file.

string.name: track_list_save_sd
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, the menu option to save the track to the SD card.

string.name: track_list_save_tcx_file
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, under the 'Save to SD card...' option, the menu option to save the track as a TCX file.

string.name: track_list_send_google
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, the menu option to send the track to Google.

string.name: track_list_share_csv_file
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, under the 'Share with friends...' option, the menu option to share the track as a CSV file with friends.

string.name: track_list_share_gpx_file
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, under the 'Share with friends...' option, the menu option to share the track as a GPX file with friends.

string.name: track_list_share_kml_file
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, under the 'Share with friends...' option, the menu option to share the track as a KML file with friends.

string.name: track_list_share_tcx_file
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, under the 'Share with friends...' option, the menu option to share the track as a TCX file with friends.

string.name: track_list_share_track
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, the menu option to share the track with friends through other applications.

string.name: track_list_share_url
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, under the 'Share with friends...' option, the menu option to save a track to My Maps or Fusion Tables and share the URL with friends.

resources.string: My Map or Fusion Table URL

string.name: track_list_show_on_map
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, the menu option to show the track on the map.

string.name: track_list_this_track
string.translation_description: In the context menu for a track, the title indicating that all the menu options below are for this track.

string.name: track_name_format
string.translation_description: When creating a new track, the string format to name the track. E.g., 'Track 1'.

string.name: track_record_error
string.translation_description: When starting a recording, message when not able to start due to no GPS location and asking the user to try again.

resources.string: Unable to start recording. No GPS location. Try again.

string.name: track_record_notification
string.translation_description: When recording a track, the message on the My Tracks notification informing the user that My Tracks is actively recording his track.

string.name: track_record_success
string.translation_description: When starting a new track recording, a status message indicating success.

string.name: unit_beat_per_minute
string.translation_description: Abbreviation for beats per minute, unit for heart rate. E.g., 'heart rate: 80 bpm'.

string.name: unit_feet
string.translation_description: Abbreviation for feet. E.g., '2 ft'.

string.name: unit_hour
string.translation_description: Abbreviation for hours. E.g, '2 hr'.

string.name: unit_kilometer
string.translation_description: Abbreviation for kilometers. E.g., '2 km'.

string.name: unit_kilometer_per_hour
string.translation_description: Abbreviation for kilometers per hour. E.g, '5 km/h'.

string.name: unit_meter
string.translation_description: Abbreviation for meters. E.g., '2 m'.

string.name: unit_mile
string.translation_description: Abbreviation for miles. E.g., '2 mi'.

string.name: unit_mile_per_hour
string.translation_description: Abbreviation for miles per hour. E.g, '5 mi/h'.

string.name: unit_minute
string.translation_description: Abbreviation for minutes. E.g, '2 min'.

string.name: unit_minute_per_kilometer
string.translation_description: Abbreviation for minutes per kilometer. E.g, '5 min/km'.

string.name: unit_minute_per_mile
string.translation_description: Abbreviation for minutes per mile. E.g, '5 min/mi'.

string.name: unit_revolution_per_minute
string.translation_description: Abbreviation for revolutions per minute, unit for cadence. E.g., 'cadence: 80 rpm'.

string.name: unit_watt
string.translation_description: Abbreviation for watts, unit for power. E.g., 'power: 80 W'.

string.name: voice_hour
string.translation_description: For voice announcement, to say hour like 'one hour'.

string.name: voice_hours
string.translation_description: For voice announcement, to say hours like 'two hours'.

string.name: voice_kilometer_per_hour
string.translation_description: For voice announcement, to say 'kilometers per hour' for speed like 'two kilometers per hour'.

string.name: voice_kilometers
string.translation_description: For voice announcement, to say kilometers like 'two kilometers'.

string.name: voice_mile_per_hour
string.translation_description: For voice announcement, to say 'miles per hour' for speed like 'two miles per hour'.

string.name: voice_miles
string.translation_description: For voice announcement, to say miles like 'two miles'.

string.name: voice_minute
string.translation_description: For voice announcement, to say minute like 'one minute'.

string.name: voice_minutes
string.translation_description: For voice announcement, to say minutes like 'two minutes'.

string.name: voice_no_distance
string.translation_description: For the voice announcement, the announcement when the current track's total distance is zero.

string.name: voice_per_kilometer
string.translation_description: For voice announcement, to say 'per kilometer' for pace like 'two minutes per kilometer'.

string.name: voice_per_mile
string.translation_description: For voice announcement, to say 'per mile' for pace like 'two minutes per mile'.

string.name: voice_second
string.translation_description: For voice announcement, to say second like 'one second'.

string.name: voice_seconds
string.translation_description: For voice announcement, to say seconds like 'two seconds'.

string.name: voice_template
string.translation_description:
For the voice announcement, the template to make an announcement. E.g., 'My Tracks total distance 5.2 miles in 2 hours 30 minutes at 2.2 miles per hour'. Below is the list of the parameters:
%1$.2f: Distance value (E.g., 5.2) %2$s: Distance unit (miles or kilometers) %3$s: Time value (E.g., 2 hours and 30 minutes) %4$s: Speed value (E.g., 2.2) or pace value (E.g., 2 hours and 30 minutes) %5$s: Speed unit (miles per hour or kilometers per hour) or pace unit (per mile or per kilometer)

resources.string: My Tracks total distance %1$.2f %2$s in %3$s at %4$s %5$s

string.name: welcome_about
string.translation_description: In the 'Welcome' page, the button on the bottom to read the 'About' page.

string.name: welcome_title
string.translation_description: The title of the welcome page.
